editionStmt.edition: Digital edition according to TEI P5

availability.licence: This document is published under the Creative Commons licence Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

msDesc.head: Composite manuscript: Hincmar of Reims (letters and texts); Isidore's Chronica; astronomical miscellany with parts from the RAL Reims (?), North-east France s. IX and s. X

extent.measure: iii (modern paper) + 1 (medieval parchment here numered I) + 1 (modern paper) + 128 fols.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in red inc on the top right corner of every recto (1-128). Previous pagination in pencil on the top outher corner of every recto and verso (1-122).

physDesc.additions: Table of content added in s. XII (?) on the first medieval flyleaf listing the letter of Pope Nicolaus I to Hincmar as wll as ysidorus de distinctione temporum and reuolutio spere.

binding.p: The original carolingian binding was restaurated preserving, however, its characteristics. The wooden boards have probably never been covered. The coat of armsJacob Pamelius engraved on the front. For a detailed description of the binding see Léon Gilissen,La reliure occidentale antérieure à 1400 d’après les manuscrits de la Bibliothèque Royale Albert Ier à Bruxelles (Turnhout: Brepols, 1983), pp. 31-73, 118-121 and plates V, VII, VIII, XXIII, XXV and LIV, and Berthe Van Regemorter, 'Évolution de la technique de la reliure,'Scriptorium 2 (1948): 275-285.

history.summary: The manuscript is composed of several codicological units.

origin.p: Codicological unit 1 encompass the first two quires (ff.1-14). The third quire (ff.15-22) is written by a different contemporary hand but has a quire markVI on f. 22v. This suggests that here starts a separate codicological unit, labeled here 2 (ff.15-33). The following quire V (ff.34-41) begins without any title and touches on the same topic as the previous text (on the deposition of Rothad of Soissons). The end overlaps with the end of the quire numbered IIII. This indicate either that this quire once preceded the third quire or that it belonged to another manuscript. The slight differences in the layout (dimensions of the written space) give some preferences for the second suggestion and so in this description ff.34-41 are listed as a separate codicological unit 3. The first 41 folios were copied in Reims ca. 853 in typische Hincmar-Minuskel ( Bischoff, Katalog I ). Silvestre (1953) dated these quires to the years 862-867.
Codicological unit 4 on quire VI (ff.42-49) was written probably inReims in s. X1 ( Bischoff, Katalog I ). Silvestre (1953) dated it to s. IX.

Codicological unit 6 on quires VIII-XIII and XV (ff.63-108 and 117-124) was written inNorth-east France in s. IX3/3 ( Bischoff, Katalog I ). Quire-mark II-V on f. 78v, 86v, 94v, 100v respectively (first quire-mark probably cut out with the lower margin missing on f. 70).
Codicological unit 7 on quire XIV (ff.109-116) is dated by Bischoff (1967) tos. X2 . He noticed that the quire was once folded in two - a sign that it was carried probably in the inner pocket.
Ff. 125-128 (here labelled as Codicological unit 8) were written inBretagne in s.IX1 ( Bischoff, Katalog I ). It is not sure how these leaves were once attached to the codex.

history.provenance: Pamelius donated the manuscript to theJesuit College in Bruges, cf. the exlibris on the first flyleaf Collegii Societatis Iesu Brug. ex dono Rmt D. Iac. Pamelii.

acquisition.p: After the suppression of the Jesuit Colleges ins. XVIII the manuscript was transferred to the Royal Library in Brussels.

msItem.author: Hincmar
msItem.title: Epistula ad Hardwicum et Teutgaudum
msItem.incipit: Hincmarus nomine non merito remorum episcopus ac plebis dei famulus harduico et teutgaudo carissimis et reuerissimis salutem
msItem.note: Text goes vertically. Visible corrections, which would suggest this was perhaps the draft of the letter. According to Bischoff it is a typical Hincmar-minuscle (see his Katalog I, p. 154).
Letter of Pope Nicolaus I to emperor Louis.
msItem.incipit: Nicolausepiscopus seruus seruorum dei dilecto filio rolo glorioso regi· Comperiat celsitudo uestra
msItem.explicit: ualere dilectissime file D Kalendas nouembrias indictione prima.
msItem.note: Marginal notes from a modern hand.
Letter of Pope Nicolaus I to Hincmar
msItem.incipit: Nicolaus episcopus seruus seruorum dei· Reuerentissimis et sanctissimis hincmar et ceteris confratribus nostris archiepiscopis Omnium nos portare onera
msItem.explicit: scriptorum tuorum serie relator inueniaris. datae X Kalendas nouembris indictione prima.

msItem.note: blank

msItem.title: De primatu ecclesiae
msItem.incipit: Sin autem communi cunctorum decreto rationabili et secundum regulam ecclesiasticam comprobato duo aut tres
msItem.explicit: nulla erunt de alieni usurpation certamina.
msItem.bibl: Perels, Ernst. "Eine Denkschrift Hinkmars von Reims im Prozeß Rothads von Soissons,"Neues Archiv der Gesellschaft für ältere deutsche Geschichtskunde 44 (1922): 43-100.

supportDesc.condition: f. 33 has only three lines with the end of the text on the recto. The rest of the folio was probably left blank and hence cut off for reuse.

msItem.note: On the deposition Rothadus, bishop of Suessionensis
msItem.incipit: Denique quod quidam dicunt quoniam rothadus post depositionem suam libellous proclamationis
msItem.explicit: contra ueritatem euangelicam sentientes dicente dno.
msItem.bibl: Perels, Ernst. "Eine Denkschrift Hinkmars von Reims im Prozeß Rothads von Soissons,"Neues Archiv der Gesellschaft für ältere deutsche Geschichtskunde 44 (1922): 43-100.

msItem.author: Augustine of Hippo
msItem.title: De baptismo contra Donatistas libri septem(excerpt from Book 3 and 4)
msItem.incipit: caritatis inimici siue sperte foris sint siue intus esse uideantur
msItem.note: Acephalus missing a title and text at the beginning and ends abruptly with the end of a quire numberedVIII.
blank.
Protocol from the Council of Soissans 853.
msItem.incipit: Residentibus in synodo uenerabilibus episcopiss. Hincmaro remensis ecclesiae archiepiscopo
msItem.explicit: super terram si ligata non sunt in caelis quae ipsi ligauerit in terris.
msItem.bibl: Hartmann, Wilfried (ed.) inMGH Concilia Vol. 3: Die Konzilien der karolingischen Teilreiche 843-859, pp. 264-279.

msItem.note: blank.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: According to Bischoff (Katalog I, p. 154) the part is written inReimser minuscle.

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: Chronica
msItem.incipit: Breuem temporum expositionem per generations et regna Primus ex nostris iulius africanus
msItem.explicit: migrat homo tunc illi consumatio seculi est.

msItem.title: Series annorum mundi secundum antiquos patres
msItem.rubric: Numerus annorum ab initio mundis secundum eusebium et ceteros usque in presentem annum.
msItem.incipit: Eusebius caesarensis episcopus dicit sunt anni ab adam usque ad diluuium
msItem.explicit: Utputa secundum fiunt simul anni VI milia et VIIII. Iste est numerus annorum ab initio mundi usque ad praesentem annum.

msItem.title: Series annorum mundi nova
msItem.rubric: In dei nomine series annorum ab initio mundi secundum hebraicam ueritatem ut alli dicunt incipit
msItem.incipit: Adam cum CXXX esset annorum genuit seth seth autem habens annos CV genuit enos
msItem.explicit: sunt autem totius summe ab origine mundi usque in praesentem annum I̅I̅I̅I̅.

msItem.title: De ratione conputandi secundum solem et lunam(Scottus Rat.)
msItem.incipit: Sciendum nobis quomodo sol in principalibus linguis uocatur Ita gamse uel simsia
msItem.explicit: paschalis solempnitatis celebrari summa breuitate notauit.

msItem.note: Computistical argumenta taken fromLibri computi (Book IIII, 8 and II, 16-17).
msItem.incipit: In cyclo decennouenali sunt anni lunares XVIIII de quibus
msItem.explicit: numerum lunationis eiusdem subtraxeris remanebit tibi regularis mensis sequentis.

msItem.note: Later addition medical recepies (s.X): Excerpts fromPseudo-Dioscorides' De herbis femineis.
msItem.incipit: Erba heliotropium ubicumque fuerit nec fastus neque striga accidit
msItem.explicit: quos greci oegilupas uocant cum umosico sale trita instruit.

listBibl.bibl: Transcribed inSilvestre, Hubert. “Notices et extraits des manuscrits 5413-22, 10098-105 et 10127-44 de la Bibliothèque Royale de Bruxelles.” Sacris erudiri 5 (1953): 174–92 (here pp. 182-83).
Kästner, H. F. "Pseudo-Dioscoridis de herbis femininis,"Hermes 31 (1896): 578-636 (here pp. 624-25).

msItem.title: Involutio spherae
msItem.incipit: Hic est stellarum ordo utrorumque circulorum septentriones duplices
msItem.explicit: Conexio uero piscium commune habet stellam.

msItem.note: On the zodiac
msItem.incipit: Porro xii signorum ordo hic est
msItem.explicit: Id est saturnus iouis mars sol uenus mercurius luna.

msItem.note: Sections fromRAL on the planets.
msItem.incipit: Cum sole et luna septem astra numerantur quae non sunt fixa in caelo ut caetera
msItem.explicit: quod ora nona procliuior uergens ab occasu pronus incubat.

msItem.note: Three short texts: 1) on the zodiacal signs within the calendar:Aries taurus geminus cancer XV Kalnedis aprilis ingreditur sol in signum arietis sic et ceteri mensis in medio suo inuius cuiusque ingreditur et in alio medio finitur; followed by 2) a verse on each of the months: Respicis aprilis aries frixe Kalendas procedunt duplices in marcia tempora pisces; and 3) on the motion of the sun and the moon: sol CCCLXV. Luna uero XXVII diebus et octo oras. Zodiacum ambitum lustrant. SIngula uero signa sol tricenis diebus et denis horis ac semisse, luna autem binis dienus et senis horis ac bisse unius hore perlabitur, quod facit sol in una die facit luna in XII dies; quod facit sol in una hora facit luna in XIII horas. Luna cotidie quatuor punctas elongabitur a sole crescens IIIIor adpropinquans decrescens.

msItem.author: Ps. Censorinus
msItem.title: Fragmenta Censorini (cap. 3)
msItem.incipit: Stellarum alie cun celum feruntur ideoque quod non excedunt suos locos fixe nominantur
msItem.explicit: iuppitermercorius uarie et quomodo consentit aut uisus est.

msItem.note: List of the constellations:
msItem.quote: Semispheria. Inuolutio sphere arcturus maior arcturus minor Serpens inter ambas arcturus hercules corona anticanis quinque planete. Lacteus circulus. Presepe et asini.

msItem.note: Later addition: On the clothes proper for a priest.
msItem.incipit: Si quidem pontifex hocto haber speties uestimentorum. longum est nunc dicere de ephot, de tonica
msItem.explicit: quo se pro nobis in altam crucis obtulit ostiam patris.

msItem.note: Later addition: Preverbs
msItem.incipit: Pinguis uenter tenuemsenssum gignit

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Accroding to Bischoff (Katalog I, p. 155) several hands, with insular abbreviation, partly misunderstood the abbreviations in the exemplar.

msItem.note: Computistical argumenta divided in unnumbered chapters.
msItem.incipit: Pasce quartas decimas lunas earumque annuas appellationes absque difficultate reperies si nonas aprilis retinens
msItem.explicit: Eclypsis solis est quociens luna XXXma ad eandem lineam quam sol uehitur peruenit eique se obiciens

msItem.author: Arator
msItem.note: Fragments fromDe actibus apostolorum, Book II, vv. 613-658 (f. 126), vv. 712-755 (f. 128), vv. 761-782, 788-908 (f. 127), vv. 857-910 (f. 125).
